column4: ok i got it just needed python now for the final question of the night is this correct if i want to add ~/bin to path  i put export PATH:$PATH=~/bin;  in bach_profile ?
~ does not work if it has a char before it
oh and it should look like this: export PATH=$PATH:$HOME/bin
you need to relogin or source ~/.bash_profile
.bash_profile is only loaded when you login.. .bashrc is loaded for every terminal
thanks i found a work around before looking at that let me see your method
how hard is it to edit? have you found a version in $HOME?
thanks for the info but after reading it i'm still confused i kinda understand how to add a directory to the menu but to actually add a file within that dir i'm confused
